decks.notes: The main concept of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and removal spells. With a focus on low-cost creatures like Glint Hawk and Refurbished Familiar, as well as cards like Cast Down and Tithing Blade to control the board, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Okiba-Gang Shinobi and Faerie Macabre also provides disruption against the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes mana sources like Goldmire Bridge and Ancient Den to ensure consistent plays.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, quick creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and protect your creatures. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent alongside counter spells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce, you can maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, cards like Thought Scour and Deep Analysis help to maintain card advantage and fuel graveyard synergies. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Sneaky Snacker, as well as efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the deck aims to deal damage rapidly and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Fiery Temper and Highway Robbery provide additional reach, ensuring that the opponent's life total goes down quickly. The deck also includes card draw and theft effects to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers.

The main goal of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing low mana cost creatures such as Kitchen Imp and Sneaky Snacker, paired with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss provide both burn damage and lifegain, allowing the player to maintain their own life total while pressuring the opponent. The deck also includes some card draw and graveyard recursion to ensure consistency and fuel the aggressive strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly create powerful creatures by enchanting them with various auras, making them difficult to deal with for the opponent. The deck focuses on having low-cost creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle, which can be buffed with enchantments like Ancestral Mask, Ethereal Armor, and Rancor. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with strong, evasive creatures that can deal a lot of damage quickly. The deck also includes some removal spells like Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble to deal with opposing threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through efficient card advantage and disruptive spells, while also utilizing the Ephemerate mechanic for value. By using creatures like God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Sunscape Familiar in combination with cards like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, the deck can outvalue opponents in the long game. Cryogen Relic and other control spells like Prohibit and Lose Focus help stall the opponent's threats while Ghostly Flicker and Ephemerate provide extra value and recursion. Meeting of Minds and LÃ³rien Revealed can generate even more card advantage to aid in locking down the game.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures that can grow in power quickly. By sacrificing creatures and utilizing graveyard synergies, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while also disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a focus on efficient and low-cost creatures, along with spells that provide card advantage and combat tricks, the Mono Black Aggro deck is designed to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and efficient spells, while also maintaining control of the game through counter spells and card draw. The strategy involves using cards like Cryptic Serpent, Delver of Secrets, and Tolarian Terror to apply pressure early on, while utilizing counterspells like Counterspell, Dispel, Force Spike, and Spell Pierce to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm, Mental Note, Thought Scour, and Ponder help ensure consistency and allow for optimal plays each turn.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Wild Growth to play high-power creatures like Avenging Hunter and Nyxborn Hydra. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Malevolent Rumble to control the board and Lead the Stampede to refill your hand with creatures. By overwhelming the opponent with fast and powerful creatures, this aggressive deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own board presence.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells to disrupt your opponent's strategy, while also generating card advantage through cards like Mulldrifter and Augur of Bolas. The synergy with Ephemerate allows you to reuse key creatures like Archaeomancer and Mulldrifter, while also providing protection for your creatures. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Skred and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats on the board. The mana base includes snow lands to support cards like Skred, while also providing access to multiple colors for a versatile control strategy.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on creating a high-pressure board presence early in the game by using efficient creatures like Refurbished Familiar and Gixian Infiltrator. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Krark-Clan Shaman to control the opponent's board while maintaining its own aggressive strategy. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Ichor Wellspring and Nihil Spellbomb to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of low-cost creatures and efficient counterspells. Faeries like Faerie Miscreant and Faerie Seer provide early game presence while cards like Moon-Circuit Hacker and Ninja of the Deep Hours offer card advantage. Spellstutter Sprite serves as a versatile counter and disruption tool. The deck also includes utility cards like Snap and Dispel to control the board and protect its own creatures. With a total of 18 Islands, this deck aims to maintain a consistent mana base for its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap threats and disrupting the opponent with counterspells and card draw. By efficiently utilizing low-cost spells and powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Delver of Secrets, it aims to apply pressure and control the game tempo. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to consistently develop a threatening board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and card advantage.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. With a mix of creatures that can be cast for free and efficient burn spells, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible. The mana base is simple and efficient, allowing for consistent casting of spells without any color issues. Overall, this deck is built for speed and aggression in order to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Goblin Bushwhacker to quickly build a threatening board presence. Supporting burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast provide additional reach to clear the way for attacking creatures. The deck also includes card draw and mana acceleration to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a low mana curve and efficient creatures, this deck aims to quickly deal damage and secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful Urzatron lands, while utilizing artifact creatures like Myr Retriever and Myr Kinsmith to generate value and create a strong board presence. The deck also includes various ways to generate mana and draw cards, such as Chromatic Star and Prophetic Prism. Additionally, there are options for dealing damage and sacrificing creatures for additional benefits with cards like Pactdoll Terror and Ashnod's Altar. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and efficient resource management.
